subject: NEW: Centralized Git Branching Strategy Document
body:
Team,

El Gotan has approved a standardized git branching strategy. A new central document has been created that ALL agents must read before performing git operations.

## Document Location

```
/Users/tobybalsley/MyDocs/AppDev/MasterCalendar/docs/GIT-BRANCHING-STRATEGY.md
```

## Key Points

| Branch | Mode | Permissions |
|--------|------|-------------|
| DEVL | Autonomous | Commit, push, create feature branches |
| TEST | Semi-controlled | Push with announcement; CR for risky |
| PROD | Locked | ALWAYS require explicit approval |

## What Changed

1. Local GIT-Strategy sections in each CLAUDE.md have been replaced with references to the central doc
2. YBOTBOT-BRANCH-AUTONOMY sections have been simplified
3. All projects now follow the same workflow: DEVL → TEST → PROD

## Action Required

- Read the central doc before your next git operation
- Follow the CR (Change Request) triggers for TEST deployments
- NEVER push to PROD without explicit user approval

## CR Triggers (require approval for TEST)

- Database/schema changes
- Auth/security changes
- External API changes
- Multi-file refactors
- Breaking changes

— Quinn
